greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of central divisors of n.
comment: If n is a square (A000290) then a(n) = sqrt(n) because the squares have only one central divisor. If n is a prime p then a(n) = 1 + p = A000203(n). For the number of central divisors of n see A169695.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Omar E. Pol, Illustration of the divisors of the first 12 positive integers
example: For n = 12 the divisors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. The central (or middle) divisors of 12 are 3 and 4, so a(12) = 3 + 4 = 7.
mathematica: cdn[n_]:=Module[{dn=Divisors[n],len},len=Length[dn]; Which[ IntegerQ[ Sqrt[n]], Sqrt[n], PrimeQ[n],n+1, OddQ[len],dn[[Floor[len/2]+1]], EvenQ[len],dn[[len/2]]+dn[[len/2+1]]]]; Array[cdn,70] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 07 2012 *)
xref: Row sums of A207375. Where records occur give A008578.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 23 2012
